page.name: Course Resources
page.content:
These resources provide more in-depth information about the concepts and practices taught in this course. Use the resources to apply the concepts and to expand your knowledge of energy literacy into your adult education classroom. You may want to print this screen for future use.

AirNow. (n.d.) Retrieved from http://www.airnow.gov/index.cfm?action=airnow.main

AirNow. (n.d.) Air Quality Index (AQI) Basics. Retrieved from http://www.airnow.gov/index.cfm?action=aqibasics.aqi

Association of Energy Service Professionals. (2012-2015). My Energy Gateway. Retrieved from http://www.myenergygateway.org/career-options

Barclay, E. (2012). A nation of meat eaters: see how it all adds up. NPR. Retrieved from http://www.npr.org/blogs/thesalt/2012/06/27/155527365/visualizing-a-nation-of-meat-eaters

Beijing Air Pollution: Real-time Air Quality Index (AQI). (2015). AQICN & World Air Quality Info. Retrieved from http://aqicn.org/city/beijing/

CLEAN – Climate Literacy & Energy Awareness Network. Retrieved from http://cleanet.org/clean/literacy/energy_lit.html

Connecticut Energy Education (n.d.) Energy Efficiency. Retrieved from http://www.ctenergyeducation.com/lessons.htm?cat=qwv6u0ax

Eschooltoday. (n.d.) Your cool facts and tips on ecosystems: Food chains. Retrieved from http://eschooltoday.com/ecosystems/what-is-a-foodchain.html
